div.head:
Embleme 44. Of the Secrets of Nature.
Typhon kills Osyris by deceipt, and disperseth the parts of his body on
all sides, but the famous Isis gathered them together.

lg.l: Ægypt, Osyris, all the Sunne o'th wise:
By cruell Typhon, all together putt:
But the productive part is lost i'th Sea,
For Sulphur Sulphur's father's fled away.

div.head: Discourse 44.
div.ab:
The allegory of Osyris wee have elswhere (namely in the first
booke of Hieroglyphicks) reduced to its true originall, which is
Chymicall, and fully explaind it: Wherefore here to repeat the
same things (though the same things ought to be spoken of the-
same things) wee judge superfluous: but neverthelesse wee will
here forme a parallell discourse, which will allwayes be and re
maine within the prisons of that ancient Chymy, which is solely
decanted and decipered by the Poetts: Will you perswade mee-
that Osyris was a God, or King of the Ægyptians? I will not be
leive, though you perswade mee to beleive; For doggs (as it is in-
the Proverb) smell farre otherwise, farre otherwise Swine: I doe
plainly deny him to be a God, and you will ascent to mee, unlesse
you be a heathen, or of an opinion contradictory to right reason:
And that hee was noe King, is demonstrated by all the circum
stances which are elswhere considered: The Sunne hee is, but-
Philosophicall, the name of which being in many authors often at
tributed to it, the vulgar, who know noe other light but that of the-
world, have interpreted for it. The Philosophers Sunne hath denomi
nation from the Sunne of the World, because it contains the propertyes
of nature descending from that cælestiall Sunne, or agreable to it: Osyris
therefore, Dionysus, Bacchus, Jupiter, Mars, Adonis, Œdipus, Perseus, Achil
les, Triptolemus, Pelops, Hippomenes, and Pollux are the Sunne: but-
Isis, Juno, Venus, the mother of Œdipus, Danaë, Deidamia, Atalanta,
Helena, the Moone; as allso Latona, Semele, Europa, Leda, Antiope-
Thalia. And these are the parts of the compound, which before ope
ration is called Stone, and by the name of every metall, Magnesia:-
After operation, Orcus, Pyrrhus, Apollo, Æsculapius. The adjuncts are-
Typhon, Python, the Boar: The Artists are Hercules, Ulissess, Jason,-
Theseus, Pyrithous: The labours and perills, which were undergone by
these artists, are innumerable: The labours of Hercules, the errours of
Ulysses, the perills of Jason, the attempts of Theseus, and the remora's of
Pyrithous may be seen: This is the great volume of matter and doc
trine, through which in every page Vulcan, Mercury, and Saturne doe
runne backwards and forwards, the first, as the father and cause of all,
without which nothing is effected, the second, as the matter and forme,
the third, as the efficient. Sol takes his sister Luna to wife: Jupiter Juno,
as Saturne Rhea, and Osyris Isis: Dionysus is rippd out of his mother Se
mele being burnt by the lightening of Jove to be matured in the-
thigh of Jupiter his father, Æsculapius out of Coronis his Mother: Dio
nysus coming to maturity shews men a new way of drinking wine, un
dertaking an expedition even to the Indyes; Osyris and Triptolemus,
the sowing and use of fruit, Æsculapius, the administration of Me
Discourse 44.
dicine: Dionysus soe calld by the Greeks, is Bacchus with the Romans,-
with the Ægyptians Osyris, with the Syrians Adonis. Œdipus killd his father
and marryd his mother; Perseus slew his Grand=father, Typhon his bro
ther Osyris, a Boar Adonis, Ceres the nurce of Triptolemus his father
Eleusius; Hippomenes obtainedovercame Atalanta by a golden apple. Tantalus
the father of Pelops obtained Hippodamia by the dispute of a Chariott.
Osyris was cutt in peices, and joyned together againe by Isis his mother,
sister, and wife. The child Pelops was boyld and dressd, and his shoulder
eaten by Ceres, and againe restord to life, an ivory shoulder being added:
Achilles and Triptolemus were put under coals of fire by night, and in
the day time nourished with milke, Achilles by Ceres his Nurce, TriptoAchillis
lemus by his mother Thetis: Achilles and Helena were the causes of the
Trojane warre, 1 Achilles, 5 as 6 impulsive, 4 Helena, 2 as 3 efficient; Helena was
hatchd of an egge, and at the nuptialls of Peleus and Thetis, from whom
Achilles descended, the apple of Eris, the first cause of the rape of-
Helena, was throwne about. Pollux was with the Argonauts, who (if they
lived) are præsupposed to have lived near fifty years before the be
gining of the Trojane warre, and Helena with Pollux came both
out of one egge; Helena therefore was an old woman when she was
ravishd by Paris: Medea was marryd to Achilles in the Elysian feilds,
then an old toothlesse woman: unlesse perhaps Shee restored youth to
herselfe, as Shee did to Æson, the father of Jason, and as Ceres to Pe
lops, for which reason hee is sayd to become twice young: Perseus re
ceivd a flying horse from Pallas, and in recompence brought her
the head of Medusa, to whome Mercury gave a Semitar, and
other Gods other weapons; Ceres gave Triptolemus a chariot-
with flying Dragons: When Pallas was borne of Jupiters braine,
as allso when Sol lay with Venus it rained gold at Rhodes;-
And Jupiter in the forme of a golden shower had coition with
Danae, as a Swanne compressed Leda, as a Cuckow his Sister-
Juno, as a Bull Europa, as a Satyre Antiope, and soe there
is cohærente in all. . . . . . . . . .
